verses.verse: Are we starting to speak well of ourselves, or do we need, as some others do, letters of recommendation to you or from you?
You are our letter written in our hearts, known and read by all people.
[You are] clearly seen to be the letter by Christ delivered by us, not written with ink but by the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of flesh, the heart.
Such trust we have of God through Christ.
Not that I have all that is needed in myself, but our sufficiency is from God,
who has also enabled us to be servants of the New Covenant, not of the letter but of the spirit, for the letter kills, but the spirit gives life.

So if what ministers death--written and engraved on stones--was so glorious that the children of Israel could not look for long at Moses' face, because of the glory of his face (a glory which was going to leave),
how much more [glorious] is the ministry of the spirit?
For if the ministry of condemnation is glorious, so much more the ministry of righteousness surpasses it in glory.
For even that which was made glorious really had no glory in this respect because of the glory that surpasses it.
For if what was done away with was glorious, so much more is what remains glorious.
Seeing that we have such hope, we speak very bluntly.
Not like Moses who put a veil over his face, so the children of Israel wouldn't stare at that which was going to end.
Their minds were blinded, for even to this day that same veil remains in place in the reading of the Old Testament. This veil is done away by Christ.
Even today when Moses is read, this veil is over their heart.
Nevertheless when it will return to the Lord, the veil will be taken away.
The Lord is that Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.
All of us, with an open face seeing the Lord's glory as in a mirror are changed into the same likeness from glory to glory by the Spirit of the Lord.
